title: Chiltern Way Berkshire Loop Walking Route

images.title: Andrew Smith / Crowsley Park
images.caption: Crowsley Park.  A relatively small herd of cattle were gathered in this part of the park. I believe that they are White Parks, similar to British Whites but with horns. This shows the view across the dry valley of Harpsden Bottom.

images.title: The west bank of the River Thames at Henley-on-Thames by Matthew Bristow, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The west bank of the River Thames at Henley-on-Thames

images.title: The River Thames at Cookham by Peter S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Thames at Cookham

images.title: Popes Lane, Cookham Dean by Des Blenkinsopp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Popes Lane, Cookham Dean

description: This walk runs from the outskirts of High Wycombe to Crowsley Park , near Henley on Thames. The route includes several long sections along the River Thames where you will pass a series of delightful riverside towns and villages. These include Cookham and then Henley-on-Thames , home to the famous annual regatta. The path also includes a couple of lovely wooded sections through Mill Wood and Cayton Park with the Chiltern Hills providing a beautiful backdrop for the duration of the walk.
